#Text=Interview with Mathew Njenga , City Council candidate for Wards 2 & 6 in Brampton , Canada
#Text=Thursday , October 5 , 2006
#Text=The upcoming 2006 Brampton municipal election , to be held November 13 , features an array of candidates looking to represent their wards in city council or the council of the Peel Region .
#Text=Wikinews contributor Nick Moreau contacted many of the candidates , including Mathew Njenga , asking them to answer common questions sent in an email .
#Text=This ward 's incumbent is John A. Hutton ; also challenging Hutton is Derrick Coke , Navdeep Gill , Jim Howell , Joyce Rodriguez , and Doug Whillans .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Q :
#Text=List the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=A :
#Text=The three top issues for my campaign are crime , urban sprawl , and the environment .
#Text=Q :
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=A :
#Text=Urban Sprawl –
#Text=The city has grown so fast especially in Wards 2 and 6 that the infrastructure , recreation centers , libraries and roads are all seriously lagging behind .
#Text=If we give our kids nothing to do they will end up falling in between the cracks .
#Text=Q :
#Text=What qualities or experiences do you possess , that make you more desirable than the incumbent ?
#Text=A :

#Text=I have worked , traveled and lived in many parts of the world and I have volunteered for the communities that I have lived in and gained a wealth of experience dealing with people from all corners of the world .

#Text=Brampton represents the world in terms of diversity due to the recent influx of immigrants and my experience dealing with diverse communities make me a more desirable candidate for City Councilor in wards 2 and 6 .
#Text=Q :
#Text=Why do you want to represent your ward on council ?
#Text=A :
#Text=The issues that affect Wards 2 and 6 range from the Environment , Urban Sprawl , Business Development , Crime and Fair representation .
#Text=My understanding of these issues in wards 2 and 6 and associated insights place me at a vantage point to address them for our common good in Brampton .
#Text=Q :
#Text=Of the decisions made by council since the last election , which one would you have changed , and why ?
#Text=A :
#Text=Since the last election , council issued a lot of construction permits for residential construction and that has had a terrible impact on the communities in Wards 2 and 6 .

#Text=In the last five years , the traffic congestion has been unreal , many residence in wards 6 have to travel far to get to a recreational center because non were build to accommodate all the new residents .
#Text=Our students study in trailers because the schools construction was lagging or the buildings were n't big enough to house all the students .
#Text=Residential home construction is a good thing but it has to be controlled .
#Text=Q :
#Text=How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=A :
#Text=Currently , I volunteer for an after school Basket Ball Program that 's put up by Stone Church Community in Wards 6 for free on Tuesday night at Fletchers Meadow .
#Text=We can only accommodate 50 students and each evening we have to turn away many willing participants because of lack of space .
#Text=The lack of a recreation center accessible to the youth demonstrates the lack of vision and forethought in community planning by council .
